com.bigdata.rdf.sail.sparql

Class TestSubqueryPatterns

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • com.bigdata.rdf.sparql.AbstractBigdataExprBuilderTestCase
          • com.bigdata.rdf.sail.sparql.TestSubqueryPatterns
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class TestSubqueryPatterns
extends AbstractBigdataExprBuilderTestCase
    Test suite for translating queries which use subquery constructions, including SubqueryRoot, NamedSubqueryRoot and NamedSubqueryInclude and ExistsNode.
    Version:
    $Id: TestGroupGraphPatternBuilder.java 5064 2011-08-21 22:50:55Z thompsonbry $
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

    • Method Detail

      • test_subSelect

        public void test_subSelect()
                    throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                           TokenMgrError,
                           ParseException
        Unit test for simple subquery without anything else in the outer join group. 
         SELECT ?s where {{SELECT ?s where {?s ?p ?o}}}
        Note: This requires recursion back in through the BigdataExprBuilder.
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
        TokenMgrError
        ParseException

      • test_optional_subSelect

        public void test_optional_subSelect()
                             throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                    TokenMgrError,
                                    ParseException
        Unit test for simple optional subquery without anything else in the outer join group. 
         SELECT ?s where { OPTIONAL {SELECT ?s where {?s ?p ?o}}}
        Note: This requires recursion back in through the BigdataExprBuilder.
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
        TokenMgrError
        ParseException
        See Also:

        • test_triplePattern_join_subSelect

          public void test_triplePattern_join_subSelect()
                                       throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                              TokenMgrError,
                                              ParseException
          Unit test for simple subquery joined with a triple pattern in the outer join group. 
           SELECT ?s where { ?s ?x ?o . {SELECT ?x where {?x ?p ?x}}}
          Throws:
          org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
          TokenMgrError
          ParseException

        • test_select_star_select_star_s_p_o

                                               TokenMgrError,
                                               ParseException
           SELECT * { SELECT * { ?s ?p ?o } }

        • test_bind_join_subSelect

          public void test_bind_join_subSelect()
                              throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                     TokenMgrError,
                                     ParseException
          Unit test for simple subquery joined with a bind. 
           SELECT ?s where { bind( as ?o) { SELECT ?s where {?s ?p ?o} } }
          Note: This requires recursion back in through the BigdataExprBuilder.
          Throws:
          org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
          TokenMgrError
          ParseException

        • test_subSubSelect

          public void test_subSubSelect()
                       throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                              TokenMgrError,
                              ParseException
          Unit test for sub-SubSelect. There is a top-level query. It uses a subquery. The subquery uses a subquery. The purpose of this is to test for the correct nesting of the generated AST.
          Throws:
          org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
          TokenMgrError
          ParseException

        • test_exists

          public void test_exists()
                 throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                        TokenMgrError,
                        ParseException
          Unit test for EXISTS. 
           PREFIX  rdf:     
 PREFIX  foaf:    
 
 SELECT ?person
 WHERE 
 {
     ?person rdf:type  foaf:Person .
     FILTER EXISTS { ?person foaf:name ?name }
 }
          Throws:
          org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
          TokenMgrError
          ParseException

        • test_not_exists

          public void test_not_exists()
                     throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                            TokenMgrError,
                            ParseException
          Unit test for NOT EXISTS. 
           PREFIX  rdf:     
 PREFIX  foaf:    
 
 SELECT ?person
 WHERE 
 {
     ?person rdf:type  foaf:Person .
     FILTER NOT EXISTS { ?person foaf:name ?name }
 }
          Throws:
          org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
          TokenMgrError
          ParseException

        • test_namedSubquery

          public void test_namedSubquery()
                        throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                               TokenMgrError,
                               ParseException
          Unit test for WITH {subquery} AS "name" and INCLUDE. The WITH must be in the top-level query. For example: 
           PREFIX rdfs: 
 SELECT ?p2
 WITH {
         SELECT DISTINCT ?p
         WHERE {
                 ?s ?p ?o
         }
 } AS %namedSet1
  WHERE {
         ?p rdfs:subPropertyOf ?p2
         INCLUDE %namedSet1
 }
          TODO Unit test to verify no recursion through the named subquery into a named subquery (this will be rejected at the AST level so it is not critical to validate it here).
          Throws:
          org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
          TokenMgrError
          ParseException
